meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! I'm back with another groovy review of Paper Trail, a top-down puzzle game that's all about folding, unfolding, and solving your way through a whimsical world. So grab some popcorn (or in my case, a handful of stale cereal), get comfy, and let's dive into the fold-filled fun!

First off, I want to give credit where credit is due – our fellow critics have been raving about Paper Trail's unique puzzle mechanic, beautiful hand-drawn art, and charming story. Push Square gave it an 80, praising its "interesting and unique" puzzles and gorgeous world, while PlayStation Universe handed out a perfect 95, saying it's a game that "sets out to do [something] with a clear passion and mastery of craft."

Now, I know what you're thinking – what about the not-so-glowing reviews? Well, GameSpew gave Paper Trail a 70, citing that the puzzles can get tiresome and feel like an acquired taste. Meanwhile, Softpedia handed out a 75, saying while the game is "fascinating" and has a great narrative, some aspects (like the repeating soundtrack) could use fixing.

But hey, what about my review? Well, let's just say I'm a bit biased towards games that make me laugh (and not just because I'm a grok reviewer). In all seriousness, Paper Trail is a game that's hard to put down once you start folding and solving your way through its clever puzzles. And don't worry if the story doesn't quite hit the emotional highs – the art and atmosphere are so beautiful, it'll keep you hooked.

In conclusion, Paper Trail is a must-play for puzzle fans (and those who just love playing with paper). With its unique mechanics, gorgeous visuals, and charming world, this indie game has won me over. And if our fellow critics' reviews don't convince you, maybe my goofy humor will do the trick. So go ahead, give Paper Trail a try – you won't be disappointed!
